perturbation.original_text: LeadersOnline shall limit contact with a Candidate to either one phone contact or one e-mail contact per calendar quarter, unless expressly agreed to by the Candidate.  LeadersOnline shall immediately cease all contact upon the request of the Candidate.
perturbation.changed_text: LeadersOnline should endeavor to limit contact with a Candidate to either one phone contact or one e-mail contact per calendar quarter, unless mutually agreeable. LeadersOnline will attempt to cease all contact upon the reasonable request of the Candidate.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies clear limitations on contacting candidates. The modified text introduces ambiguity by changing 'shall' to 'should endeavor,' 'unless expressly agreed to by the Candidate' to 'unless mutually agreeable' and 'shall immediately cease' to 'will attempt to cease' and 'the request of the Candidate' to 'reasonable request of the candidate,' weakening the obligation and making it subjective.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and other privacy laws which require clear and enforceable limits on data usage and communication.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party shall comply with all prevailing laws, rules and regulations and obtain all necessary approvals, consents and permits required by the applicable agencies of the government of the jurisdictions that apply to its activities or obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will aim to comply with general laws, rules and regulations and to obtain the generally accepted approvals, consents and permits that are commonly required by the relevant agencies of the government of the jurisdictions applicable to its general activities under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text creates a clear and comprehensive obligation to comply with all laws and regulations. The modified text weakens this by changing 'shall comply with all prevailing laws' to 'will aim to comply with general laws', adding ambiguity to the level of compliance required. The addition of 'generally accepted approvals' and 'relevant agencies' makes the requirements more subjective and less enforceable, conflicting with the objective standards required by many regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law principles requiring clear and definite obligations.

perturbation.original_text: LeadersOnline agrees to add a request in its standard registration form to identify those Users who have accessed the LeadersOnline Site based upon information contained in any promotional materials with respect to LeadersOnline on a VerticalNet Site, including any Banner, Newsletter Ad or Employer Spotlight identifying LeadersOnline, and to maintain such information in a form that can be examined by VerticalNet pursuant to Section 6.6 [Audits].
perturbation.changed_text: LeadersOnline may include a suggestion in its registration process to acknowledge Users who might have visited the LeadersOnline Site through VerticalNet promotions, and to keep related data, if feasible, in a format suitable for occasional review by VerticalNet as needed for potential auditing purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text lays out a defined requirement for LeadersOnline to track and maintain user data from VerticalNet promotions. The changed text transforms this definitive obligation into a discretionary action ('may include a suggestion'), introduces subjectivity ('if feasible,' 'suitable for occasional review'), and undermines the auditability aspect by replacing 'examined by VerticalNet' with 'as needed for potential auditing purposes,' creating uncertainty and potential non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: GDPR and CCPA, which require specific and transparent data collection and processing practices.
